intro: Dendrobium palawense, commonly known as the Palawan orchid, is a rare epiphytic orchid native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of fragrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining substrates for optimal growth. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing structural support and efficient water retention. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
